bibl.title: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, May 12, 1950

div1.p: Wallach requests that Hench put him in contact with policy-making officials of some of the important pharmaceutical companies.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, May 12, 1950
div1.opener:
Telephone: Murray Hill 4-7770
S I D N E Y W A L L A C H A S S O C I A T E S
Three Eighty One Fourth Avenue, New York 16, N. Y.
May 12, 1950
PUBLIC RELATIONS · MAGAZINE MANAGEMENT · CAMPAIGN PUBLICITY
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of May 3rd. As I wrote to you originally, I
got in touch with you as a result of my approach with Colonel Siler.
Unfortunately, I have not heard from them since my original contact
with them. I regret this very much because while the proposal may not
go through and probably will not go through as originally conceived, I
feel that those of us who are interested in full recognition of the
services of Dr. Walter Reed should cooperate to utilize this three-year
sequence. Incidentally, a publicity campaign is never an end in itself.
It is valuable only as a stimulation to other and more enduring results.

I am grateful to you, in particular, for your last sentence in which you
write that you would be glad to be of help.

I hope that I may turn to you for such help. In particular, it would be
helpful if I were able to secure through you direct personal contacts
with policy-making officials of some of the important pharmaceutical com-
panies. I want to try to enlist their interest; and believe that if I
can do so, we will have a good starting-off point for the development of
some intelligent and valuable program.

I would deeply appreciate hearing from you at your very earliest con-
venience.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Sidney Wallach SW:ap
S I D N E Y W A L L A C H
N A T H A N C A R O B E L T H
